website_summaries.verdict: These little fire starter squares allow you to get a flame going quickly without lighter fluid.
pros: Works in bonfires, grills and stoves
Naturally made from recycled wood chips and wax
Burns long enough to catch other wood on fire
cons: Sometimes a chemical smell is present when these starters burn

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: We have used this product for a few years and they were always great! They caught fire fast and helped start our wood burning stove fast. We just received a new box and they seem different. They are drier, don't light well, have a chemical smell, and they look and break apart differently than the ones we have used in the past. I am not sure if they changed how they are made (which was a big mistake) or if we got a bad box.
customer_reviews.author: kimnewbs

customer_reviews.title: These just plain work for me.  Tried others, keep on coming back.
customer_reviews.text: Love these fire starters! Easily the best I have ever used. This is my 4th order and every box had been perfect. When they break off of the 'slab' it leaves rough edges that catch fire super fast. I used them primarily with Home Fire super dense pressed wood logs that can take some time to really catch on their own. They last plenty long enough to get the job done. I strongly recommend them as the best starters and the best price and value.
customer_reviews.author: DJL

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: My only experience with fire starters, for my wood stove, has been these and Fatwood. These beat Fatwood hands down. The squares may be harder to light but only by a small amount....I've had pieces of Fatwood that has been almost impossible to light. 2 of these under my wood and you definitely have a fire.
customer_reviews.author: S. M.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the expensive big green egg ones
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses these to start his big green egg as well has getting a fire going in our firepit. Because they are so reasonably priced we don't worry about using them for all of our fire starting needs. We've bought several brands in the past but these are by far the best value for your money and work better than any others we have tried. This is the 2nd time I've purchased them because a box lasts a long time. If you are wanting to get a fire going fast then just light 2 or 3 of them and you will have it going really quickly.
customer_reviews.author: TRV

customer_reviews.title: Best fire starter ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product, there is no easier way to start a fire! I put the in the wood stove in the morning and light it and walk away, never fails. Bought a $50 box of fat wood last year which worked good but was a lot more work and effort. This comes with 144 block which at one a day gets me through the season for a great price! Love it. If you cant start a fire with this move some place warm.
customer_reviews.author: evan willian

customer_reviews.title: They are great for lighting lump charcoal
customer_reviews.text: I was just telling my oldedt son about these tonight and how awesome they are when lighting my lump charcoal on the Big Green Egg. I put two of them in for low and slow I use four for a higher heat burn. I light them with little handheld torch and in 5 minutes shut the lid and everything starts going. They are fantastic. No need of a charcoal chimney or anything of that nature. I'm on my fourth box now so obviously I like them and will continue purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Does its job extremely well
customer_reviews.text: Superb. Burns very well but lasts a long time, so I can start a fire even with wet wood. Separating the planks into squares is easy if you bend both directions. One little square is more than enough to light a fire quickly, so the box lasts for quite a while. My dad came to visit and went to light the fire for me, and assumed he had to use the entire plank (12 squares) because he had never used such an effective firelighter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Man

customer_reviews.title: works reliably, best size/price for me.
customer_reviews.text: I use one of these every day from October through March and have for years. I've had to buy other brands from the local store once in a while when I run out and have never come across one that I prefer over these. Also great for easily starting campfires. You can pack a dozen of these easily and they light right up even if their a little wet.
customer_reviews.author: William Nickodemus Hemmer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed! In the beginning I was nervous because I thought I had ordered another product and got the wrong one. They do not come already broken up, which I didn’t like at first, but because I can make them whatever size I want, I am able to control the usage and when building a harder to get started fire with not as seasoned wood- this works great and I can always use a bigger piece. Then a smaller one when I have extremely seasoned wood. Lights faster than anything I have used in the past and stays lit for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jlynn

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Effective, small, and has no chemical smell. I used two to start a fire in our fire pit. Rather than running around stuffing flammable material in the hopes of the fire staying lit, these worked perfectly. Also small and light weight enough to take backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: SJones

customer_reviews.title: Light Very Easily
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light very easily, stay lit, easy to store, effective, don't smell bad, I will buy again. Cons: Don't be fooled by how many come in the pack. Each fire starter square is pretty small so while this package comes with what seems to be a huge amount of fire starters, I wind up having to use 6-8 squares to start each fire in my firepit.
customer_reviews.author: KeysPlease

customer_reviews.title: MOST EXCELLENT! LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.text: We got these for starting our wood stove and they are just working awesomely! My husband says he can start the fire with one cube, but it takes a bit longer to start the fire. Soooo, he just blasts it with two because they are so cost effective! Lol! Way better pricing than in the store, and truly, these work better too. We're sold, and will be buying these as long as they're around!
customer_reviews.author: D. Christian

customer_reviews.title: The BEST fire starters!
customer_reviews.text: I was using another product to start my fires in the wood stove, but the store I buy them from ran out. They had these in a little box. After I tried them , I knew I would never want any other brand. I was so happy to see Amazon had these in a bigger box. They are wonderful! They hold a flame for about 15 minutes and they are so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: not for me
customer_reviews.text: everyone else seems to loveit. Not a one helped to start a fire and they were almost impossivble to break into squares. I suppose I got a bad box, but I won't make tht mistake or ever order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Bette Spagel

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have found these sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I was just about to re-order the same starters I've been using for three years now but decided to shop similar items and try these. They are about 30% cheaper than the Lightning Nuggets I used to buy and they are WAY better. I expect I'll end up using 75% less butane as well, because they light in a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Guillome

customer_reviews.title: Fanatic, easy to use, great for wood stoves
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic fire starters. I use them in my wood stove, placed between two pieces of kindling and a bigger piece on top. A 1"x1" piece starts it every time! Definitely will be my go-to fire starters for now on. Going through a stick of these a week, I figure one box will last me about most of the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: No kindling necessary.
customer_reviews.text: This is great fire starter. It's easily started itself yet completely controllable and each square (approx. 1", pre-scored) lasts long enough to start the main fuel source (wood) even without kindling, if the individual pieces are no larger than 4" or so. I expect larger pieces could be started using two or three squares, but haven't had to try it myself. They're not greasy, not "dirty" to handle. I carry a couple in my backpack when I'm hiking or hunting, just in case. They're a tiny bit expensive, but compared to other fire starters not horrible, and the convenience is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Product for Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: I have two high quality wood burners in my home. This stuff is great for igniting your paper, Fatwood, or other products to get your fires going. The purpose of this product is a primary ignition source. It keeps you from wasting time & fuel holding your lighter fluid based torch on fire starting material
customer_reviews.author: HMW

customer_reviews.title: work perfectly to start a fire
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but easy. At my age, this is the type of product I like. I like fires and want to make it easy and hassle free to start one. These accomplish that. I could do it more cheaply other ways but this is short money to lower the barrier to starting a fire which is the goal.
customer_reviews.author: Picky1

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Will only be buying these again! Crazy to think how a tiny flat square can do the job. We camped for a week and almost always needed just one square. We even shared some with some other campers who were having trouble. Perfect if you don't have a lot of room or are limited on what you can carry.
customer_reviews.author: Nic0co

customer_reviews.title: It pretty much runs all Winter
customer_reviews.text: Here in New England, a wood stove is a must. It pretty much runs all Winter. Rutland Fire Starter Squares make getting a new burn going an easy task. I have absolutely no difficulty in starting a fire with one light. Of course the quality of the draft your equipment creates plays a part in all this. I will be purchasing a new batch this Summer for the upcoming Fall.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Cantelmo

customer_reviews.title: Return Buyer...
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 2nd box now. These work very well as an alternative for the AC electric loop used to start my Vision Kamado grille. I use a longneck butane lighter to fire-off 4 individual squares to get a load of lump charcoal ready for smoking. The starter squares burn off completely in a few minutes leaving nothing to end up on what I'm smoking or grilling. Sure beats lighting-off a load of lump with something that will leave a chemical scent (like newspaper inks). It's too bad that these particular starter blocks weren't around 50 years ago when my dad used to douse charcoal briquettes with a healthy (?) dose of Gulf Charcoal Starter fluid. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: Vectorer

customer_reviews.title: It'll start a fire
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my Kamado Joe, as well as in my fire pit. Easy to use, and honestly, I cut the squares in half and they work just fine. Second time ordering these, and I can't see a reason why I wouldn't continue.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Slyter

customer_reviews.title: Don’t need much to get the fire blazing
customer_reviews.text: Best value!! Before ordering, I was afraid that it would get costly because I didn’t know how many it would require to actually light. I only have to use one block in the center and it lights very fast and easy. This one box is going to last me forever!! Finally found my go to product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Andrepont Harrigill

customer_reviews.title: I had to buy other starter cubes to light these starter cubes.
customer_reviews.text: These things are defective. I ended up throwing these in the fire after I lit it with the Weber fire starter cubes and they still didn’t want to burn.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: Lights fast and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised at how well these fire starters worked. I tried them last night on my kamado grill, tucked one down into the charcoal, lit it with just a regular butane lighter, and it lit right up. I had a fire in no time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reihart

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to light charcoal
customer_reviews.text: I use these to light charcoal in my kamado style grill. They can get a little difficult to light in really cold weather, but that’s understandable. Overall they’re an excellent value; I’ve ordered them many times already and won’t hesitate to order them again.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: These fire starters light up easily with a match and produce a hot flame that lasts plenty of time to get the logs in my fireplace started. No need to use paper or kindling with these. And they don't produce smoke or an odor.
customer_reviews.author: DannyBoy69

customer_reviews.title: works but
customer_reviews.text: if it is really windy compared to the webber cubes it does not light very easily, so that is why i rated it 4 stars, otherwise the cost and number of cubes makes this a winner if it is not windy when you light it. Use these for BBQ starter for coals in chimney
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Works Great With My Big Green Egg
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for years now to light my big green egg. And last year started using them to start my wood fireplace. And big box lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Diesel

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because the cuts for the squares are not deep enough and some panels do not have cuts at all to break the squares apart. Finding just use a little lighter fluid and great fire starters for campfires.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The very best firestarter made!!  Buy them, you will not be sorry, and they last years w/o losing their firestarting capability
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely the best fire starters I have ever found. Not sticky, burn easily, one will start a large fire in my standing fireplace. The ones from the 70's that look like spaceships! I was blessed to find a red one with red inside stove-pipe, it is the coolest thing I have, but also the warmest LOL Buy these firestarters and you will never, ever be sorry you did. They get my HIGHEST recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: LeighTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: They are horrible compared to last year. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 boxes last year & they worked great, bought a box this year & we have to use 6 squares WITH kindling (it says no kindling needed on box) to get a fire going. They smoked up my house, turned black ,& put off a horrible smell. Idk if they have changed this product or a bad box but I won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Louise Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This product makes it very easy to light fires in my fireplace. It would be difficult not to have these starters and I would not have many fires without them because it eleminates the need for rolled up newspaper and allot of kindling.
customer_reviews.author: Mary McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't expect anything more
customer_reviews.text: I use this to start charcoal in a starting chimney. It works perfectly. I lit one on fire (took two seconds) put it under the chimney filled with charcoal, and didn't have to touch it again untill the coals were ready. Great value, no need to buy the more expensive brands
customer_reviews.author: erman

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat these for starting fires!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for years and was having trouble finding them in stores, so I'm happy to have restocked for winter. I rely100% on wood heat for my house and I use 1 of these squares under medium sized wood (no paper or kindling) to start every fire. Works every time, even if they get wet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Love Them
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these amazing little fire starters for many years now. They are small and very efficient. I typically try to use only one square to start a fire and it works very well. I will keep buying this product until they quit making it.
customer_reviews.author: E Anthony T

customer_reviews.title: This product works very well every time!
customer_reviews.text: No longer need to use paper to start a fire. We use this for starting fires in the wood stove and also for outdoor fires and it always works very well. This is the best we have found to get the fires started.
customer_reviews.author: Judge Bob

customer_reviews.title: It works flawlessly!!!! EVERYTIME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was turned on to this product by my fireplace co here in the mts.....This product is perfect and I mean PERFECT for what it does.... I have a stove insert for my fireplace.... I put the starter in and I have a one match fire..... this truly is an incredible product!!!! I will swear by it.....
customer_reviews.author: ScorpioDF53

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: If you need to start a fire, these things really work. One of these squares, the ignition source, and a bit of extra kindling and you'll have a fire, pretty darn quickly. This is the second box of these things I've bought and I'll be back for more when these are gone.
customer_reviews.author: cupcake

customer_reviews.title: Great firestarter
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I switched to these after using the Weber lighter cubes for years as those dry out and feel a lot less natural. These are just as easy to use and burn longer! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ms Riki

customer_reviews.title: Ruthland Safe Fire Starter Squares
customer_reviews.text: These fire squares burn cleanly and at one at a time (about 1" square) works OK lighting kindling or small cut splintered half logs. Takes a while to get used to what they can do and cannot do. They will not ignite regular full logs but must be used to light smaller kindling or small half splintered logs first. They are easy to break-off from the rest and have no scent before lighting and when burning. Best thing about Fire Starter Squares is no more need for paper/newspaper. Paper is for the recycle bin, not for it to go up in smoke. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Peter DP

customer_reviews.title: Here's the answer!
customer_reviews.text: Starting my first fire of the season, I used two of the squares. They lit easily and gradually; they don't just burst into flame. One try got the fire going with no blowing, fanning or sticking bits of cardboard in. They work great getting the fire going again in the morning too.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Tramp

customer_reviews.title: Good fire starter, one box will last all winter.
customer_reviews.text: Great fire starter for indoor wood stove with some kindling. The box will last all winter. I get a fire going with 1 square each time without issue. Only downside is tough to light with only a match, need a lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We will never be wothout these in our home again
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these. We were struggling with starting fires in our fireplace and found these on Amazon. They work as well as they say they do. Excellent fire starter.
customer_reviews.author: marley

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: Best fire starters we’ve ever used. Rarely need to use more than one if there’s a bit of kindling along with the logs. Wish they were cheaper, but isn’t that true of everything?
customer_reviews.author: Constant Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great fire starter!!
customer_reviews.text: Consistently good fire starter. Burns long enough to get the fire going. I heat with wood and start hundreds of fires per year. This works!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Mom

customer_reviews.title: Use these, get warm.
customer_reviews.text: They light quickly and burn long enough to start kindling burning. I break them into much smaller pieces as they're really unnecessarily big. Makes em cheaper, too!
customer_reviews.author: Handycandyman

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I've been pairing one single square with 3 fatwood firestarter sticks and it works the first time, every time, even without kindling.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Superior Product
customer_reviews.text: I use a Green Egg and am generally loyal to the Green Egg product. When I saw these on Amazon I thought it would be worth trying because the cost was significantly lower. I tried these side by side with my Green Egg Fire Starters and found them to perform equal to each other. I have no problem in using them nor do I have any problem recommending them as equivalent fire starters. At the time of purchase the price was lower and the quantity was higher than the equivalent Green Egg product. I didn't see a difference using one or the other so why not save money if you can for a great product. It works!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for about 3 years now. I usually break off 4 squares for an Extra large Green Egg. When i get them from the box I like to tear them where the edges are frayed. It makes for easier lighting. Once lit I cover them lightly with the lump coal. I’m up and ready to grill in less than 10 minutes and not having to use an electric starter or blow torch. Leaves no odor or residue Taste of any kind of whatever you are grilling. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jason T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect you only need a few squares under some dry wood to get a fire going. There are allot in the box also so it will last you a while eliminates the headache of finding paper or cardboard .
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Best fire starter
customer_reviews.text: I used to start campfires with newspapers but no longer. This product does the job. Easy to use - just light a corner and it starts burning. I set it on some kindling and then add the wood. And that's it. Fire started. I highly recommend this product. (No smell and no problems touching it. Stores well.)
customer_reviews.author: Larry Balog

customer_reviews.title: Buy These and Grill Tonight!
customer_reviews.text: So, I have an XL Big Green Egg (BGE). That said, there are numerous BGE branded items for purchase across the grilling spectrum, most of which command significant mark-up due to the BGE packaging. I can say that the Rutland Fire Starter Squares are every bit as good as the BGE brand and are well below the cost of BGE brand- actually, I'm guessing that they are manufactured within the same facility. Yes, these are the same size square found in smaller packages. Yes, they work with the BGE. And yes, they are fantastic at starting lump charcoal grills
customer_reviews.author: T&T

customer_reviews.title: Fast lighting!  Great product!
customer_reviews.text: These are a fantastic product! I have used other brands of these types of starters. The Rutland fire starters light much quicker! They do a great job getting my Big Green Egg going. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Foolproof Firestarters
customer_reviews.text: Quite simple to use, I find that three usually do the trick to get the coals going on my Big Green Egg. I use a grill lighter to start the first then that lit firstarter to start the other two. Have had no issues with them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: This product is HOT!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry for the silly title on this one - couldn't resist! These are very good fire starter little bricks. I have tried a competitors version, which also worked well, but these seem to be the right size to help start anything. I use it for camp-fires, and to start my charcoal 'chimney' for the bbq. Never have had to re-light or add another one yet. Lights easily (I use a long multi purpose lighter). The amount you get is great, and often all you need is half a brick so it should last a good long time!
customer_reviews.author: Cheetahback

customer_reviews.title: I can't find anything just like them in the store
customer_reviews.text: I depend every year on ordering these for the season. I can't find anything just like them in the store, similar, but these are the best! If your wood is ever hard to get going in your wood stove, put a few logs in, with a lit one of these between them and a few pieces of small kindling of any kind....branches, wood scraps, on top, and you'll be all set. They burn for quite awhile, long enough to get the fire going. They always light well, burn a long time. Ordering these is part of my getting ready for winter routine.
customer_reviews.author: lauri

customer_reviews.title: Fire made easier
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! Skill level is key but this certainly makes the process easier. I use thesein the grill, the fire pit and the wood stove. One square and your fire will be roaring in no time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price for lots of pieces.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this yet but it's well known that they work fine and you get quite a few at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Charles V. Shanks

customer_reviews.title: Easiest fire starting device ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for many years and it just works! Handy and convenient, when trying to get a wood fire going in little time. Would recommend these to anyone looking for such an item.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wood

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using a different brand of fire starter. These are in all ways superior. 1. light with a single match 2. a single square can light my wood stove within a few minutes (using small pieces of dry firewood) 3. easy to break a single square off the larger block, takes only a little effort and my bare hands 4. packaging is a simple cardboard box, no plastic wrap or other extraneous stuff Starting a fire now takes a fraction of the time it used to!
customer_reviews.author: A. Richter

customer_reviews.title: easiest fire starter - EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to share a secret with you...this is the easiest way to start a fire - EVER! I place two logs next to each, light one fire starter square, placing it right on top where the two logs touch each other. Then I just put a few little wood scraps on top of the square and have a roaring blaze in a few minutes. It doesn't get any easier than that. I have shared this with friends, relatives and co-workers. They are all loyal customers now. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Linda B

customer_reviews.title: Best way to start lump charcoal
customer_reviews.text: I use these to start my charcoal in my ceramic grill. This works the best and you get a lot for the money
customer_reviews.author: Mehgan Keil

customer_reviews.title: Good to Grill!
customer_reviews.text: Very effective! It works as described. When you first buy it, follow the directions on the back of the box to start a fire. I used this solely for my classic Weber charcoal bbq grill. It burns evenly and get the charcoal fired up and the grill heated up in a timely fashion. So there's no long wait for the charcoal to get going. After gaining experience, you can adjust the amount you need to start a fire. I will definitely be buying this again in the future. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: A camping must have!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these fire starters! Just returned from a 4 day kayak camping trip and really needed a fire starter that packed a punch. Theses delivered just that. Lite up with a small lighter, and 3-4 squares did the trick. And they burned about 5-6 minutes, long enough start any campfire. Didn’t use on wet wood, but would bet they would work. They were also light enough to fit in my hull and would be perfect for backpacking. Actually passed it on when two more campers were heading out for three days and rain expected, hope they got the fantastic results I did. A must have for next season.
customer_reviews.author: Rennie Woj

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fire starters!
customer_reviews.text: I never used these before and was pleasantly surprised at how well they work. The instructions say to use three squares but I have found that two of these work well. I used them to light charcoal briquettes in a Weber firestarter instead of using newspaper. They are easy to light and there is no paper residue flying all around in the wind. They do a great job and there are enough in the box to last a long time. I must say that the Weber firestarters also work well but are more expensive so I am going with these for now on. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: LouA

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: These are legit. As a life long fatwood user, I was sceptical when my husband ordered these. They don't quite wedge as nicely between logs, but they burn big and for a long time. We've already purchased a second box
customer_reviews.author: hh

customer_reviews.title: Also makes an easy way to re-use non-spent coals
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely foolproof method for lighting my Big Green Egg. 2 squares 90degree bent (not completely broken apart) sitting on-end Inserted underneath the firebox will without fail get my lump charcoal going everytime. Also makes an easy way to re-use non-spent coals. I also carry a couple in my camping gear for ease of campfire starts.
customer_reviews.author: Yama

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love these firestarters. No smell, no mess and no residue they are the best I have found to use in my wood stove.
customer_reviews.author: C Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Ease of Use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a stick type fire starter for years Well known brand These lighter and smaller and very easy to use. They blow the stick type away Good Buy !!!
customer_reviews.author: brett

customer_reviews.title: value
customer_reviews.text: I've tried an awful lot of the different fire starter products. For the money, these are my favorite. In a small grill one starter works fine, 1 or 2 in a larger grill (if you are a careful "mounder" you'll be fine with 1). they start easy and burn long so charcoal starts, even if it's picked up a little moisture from sitting outside. not smelly, travel well if you take them camping, etc. Oh, and it's a box of 144 - lasts a darned long time.
customer_reviews.author: Wormer

customer_reviews.title: It's like putting little candles in the fireplace
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a box of these at a big-box hardware store, then went online to find a better deal (Amazon, right?) These little squares work great at getting the fire started. I'm burning a mix of oak and pinyon, using kindling, carboard, paper, to start the wood works, but takes time and patients. Using the Safe Lite Fire Starter Squares is fast and simple, and they don't leave a load of ash behind like cardboard does. Some folks may think this is cheating; I think it's efficient.
customer_reviews.author: oZmonKey

customer_reviews.title: Starts the fire
customer_reviews.text: It will burn for about 5 minutes, but it goes out easily. I start it and place it which might be part of the problem, i would guess placing it and then starting it would work better. Either way it does what i need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Smart

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Just light them and they will start your fire without any chemical smell. I break them into smaller pieces and they never fail.
customer_reviews.author: The Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I use these for lighting charcoal and camp fires. It is WAY easier than using newspaper.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: They work very well. I've been using these for many years. Tried other fire starters and these are the best I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Burns slow and strong
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be very compressed cardboard. The flame is strong and constant enough to get your fire started and it burns very slow
customer_reviews.author: fred j

customer_reviews.title: Easy to light
customer_reviews.text: These squares burn clean are easy to light. We put kindling in with a square. It makes starting a fire easy in our wood stove.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E Mozingo

customer_reviews.title: Work well in my wood stove
customer_reviews.text: and is cheaper than my other otion. Ragged edge makes lighting easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: These firestarter squares are great and I keep buying them. The good thing about them is no mess, no smell, and long burn time. If you have really hardwoods, you may need to use 2 to start your fire. I have a wood stove and they work perfect.
customer_reviews.author: C Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We use wet wood for our fire pit and this gets going no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bag

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome, one square lights a fire every time
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, one square lights a fire every time. When flue is cold, just lighting one will warm flue enough to prevent smoking when building the main fire. They don't crumble, or make a mess, have no odor and are compact for storage. Have tried many options but these are the best and have been routinely buying each winter for 3 years now.
customer_reviews.author: C. Byrne

customer_reviews.title: They work great every time
customer_reviews.text: Handy to have on hand and they work every time! Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dutton and Beth Armstrong, Editors

customer_reviews.title: Generate excessive smoke in chimney.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use it to start charcoal using chimney. Generated huge amounts of smoke to the point I had to dump out the chimney and extinguish the starter squares. Hard to break into the squares.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T.

customer_reviews.title: quality has gone down
customer_reviews.text: I have used their product previously from 2014. It was a great product, much better than the small white wax blocks from another manufacturer. However, they have really cut down the amount of wax on their present batch of fire starters and it is bit difficult to start. You can also see the color change. The last year's batch was bit darker (more soaked with wax) versus this years; which are much lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Moran

customer_reviews.title: Fire starter works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: These little beauties work good for starting fires. I have a Franklin type stove, but I'm sure they will work on all fire projects. I actually cut my squares smaller to stretch the product and they work just fine like that.
customer_reviews.author: Hobson

customer_reviews.title: Work just as good for my grill as higher priced ones
customer_reviews.text: Work great at a fraction of the price of one’s branded with grill manufacturer names.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Green Egg
customer_reviews.text: Two of these is the best way I have found to start my Green Egg. I have tried several things. I light them and then stack up the bigger pieces charcoal over the two burning pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Russel Robert Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to light and burn for enough time to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to light and burn for enough time to get a decent fire going without kindling. You have to break up the bigger sections into little sections, but it's easy enough to do along the indentations. I would usually use 2 of the little squares. I'm burning Oak in my fireplace, so the wood is not the easiest to start, but if you're careful about how you stack the wood, using two of these at the bottom of the stack will get the fire lit.
customer_reviews.author: PismoPat

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: They’re great if I had to say anything it would be maybe if they would come already apart but other than that a 5 all the way.
customer_reviews.author:
Mmc 

Mmc

customer_reviews.title: Work great for me
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use for starting charcoal in Weber chimneys. Using one square placed on a small slice of brick under the chimney, it's worked great every time. I especially like that there is very little ash, unlike the mess when using the traditional newspaper. The squares are very easy to break off. I use a butane kitchen torch to light them. With the torch, they take about 5 seconds to light. Eventually, I'll try them for lighting the wood stove.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce H

customer_reviews.title: These things are sweet! They make starting a fire super easy
customer_reviews.text: These things are sweet! They make starting a fire super easy. There are quite a few in the box and we have discovered you really only need a half of one each time. Put a half a brick in (they are about 1.5x1.5 inches big) with a little kindling, light the brick, set you wood up over it and before you know it you have a good fire going. Discovered them about 5 years ago and have been using them ever since and have never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: slunder

customer_reviews.title: Work the best
customer_reviews.text: Use them almost daily in our woodstove. Just need to make sure they get lit.
customer_reviews.author: Susan V

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price work very well for fire starting and charcoal burning.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price work very well for fire starting and charcoal burning for your barbecue
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: They  work.
customer_reviews.text: I can start a fire with one, if Im in a hurry, 2 will work for sure. Got to break em up yourself but otherwise work great.
customer_reviews.author: Tsuriman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the fire starter to use with the ceramic grill and it serves the purpose great. Also used it to start the fire place, also worked very efficiently. Definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Igor Kamenetskiy

customer_reviews.title: Buy With Confidence
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for the past three years and they work very well. Even if you have semi-seasoned wood, they will get it lit.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Have many grills and smokers and if I don't use my blowtorch to start them this works great for chimney starter
customer_reviews.author: Barry Greer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite firestarters
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my Kamado style, ceramic grill. Of all that I have tried, these are by far my favorite firestarters. Depending on the kind of fire I am going for, I usually start with two squares with the vent wide open and the lid up to get my coals started. Highly recommended to all grill masters and wannabes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Rutland 50B Safe Lite Fire Starter Squares, 144 Squares
product_meta.description: Rutland Safe Lite Fire Starter Squares are the BEST firestarter to start any fire. They are great for hiking, camping, outdoor fires, bbq grills, wood and pellet stoves and fireplaces. No kindling required, non-toxic, will not flavor food, and they light even when wet! Safe Lite Fire Starter squares meet the strictest air quality codes in the country. Product complies with the South Coast Air Quality Management District Rule 1174 ref. C38. California Proposition 65 Warning: Combustion (burning) of this product, produces carbon monoxide, soot, and other chemicals known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm.
feature_bullets: Rutland Safe Lite Fire Starter Squares are the best way to start your next fire, regardless of where that might be.
Safe Lite Fire Starter Squares are made of recycled wood chips and wax
No flare up and they won't flavor food
Excellent for: Grills, smokers, fire pits, bonfires, campfires, wood stoves, coal stoves
